resources.string: Hey! Everyone In This Section We Will Talk About That is Android Like Most of Us Using Android Devices But We Don\'t Know Actually What it is So Let\'s Talk About it So if We Google \"Android"\ It will Show Us Like ThisðŸ˜‰
So Basically As You Can See Here That Android is A Mobile Operating System Based on LinuxðŸ˜Š.Now We Will Dive More Deep in What is AndroidðŸ˜‰

Now Before Jumping into Android Bug Bounty And We Will Look into What are the Things Which Makes Android App Like We Will Talk About XMLs, Classes And Many More!ðŸ˜‰. Here We Will Not Talk About All XMLs or Classes We will Talk About Important XMLs and Classes

According To Google Manifest is XML File Which Contains Activities, Broadcast Receiver, Intent Filters, Permissions and Application Components Now if You Want to Learn in Deep About These Things Just Google itðŸ˜‰ Now Let\'s Talk About Why Manifest is First File You Have to Look For, As I Said That It Contains Useful Information Sometimes What DevðŸ˜Š. Do That They Will Store Something Very Useful In This, Same Scenario Happens With Strings.xml Will Talk About LaterðŸ˜Š.

Mistakes Happened When I Didn\'t Read Manifest File Like As I Said it Contains Info. About Activities So Whenever A WebView Vulnerability Comes I was Trying To Exploit and A Error Msg Popup That This Activity Doesn\'t Exists So Look into Manifest DeeplyðŸ˜Š

After Manifest File String.xml is The Most Important File In Case of Bug Bounty There are Two Case Scenario on Static Analysis One Which API_KEYS and Sensitive Information Saved in Strings.XML And Second is in Java Class(.class) or In Kotlin File(.kt)ðŸ˜Š.

API Keys are Not So Difficult to Find in Strings.XML And In This TIP I Will Say That if A Program Has Too Many Submission Then I Will Say Not Go For This But You can Go For KEYS Stored in class or kt File in That Case This Could WorkðŸ˜‰
Why Classes is Important and Most DifficultðŸ˜Š
Now The Thing You Will Notice That I am Not Saying Any About This Because You Just Need Understand The Code, What\'s Actually Scene is.ðŸ˜‰
The Biggest Question After Learning Basics About Android That Is There Any Pre-Requirements For Android Bug HuntingðŸ˜Š
I Think There are Requirements Not Necessary But If You Have These Then You were Able to Find More Bugs So Let\'s Talk About What is Requirements For It
Learn Any Language Java Or Kotlin

I Would Prefer Go For Java Because Kotlin Can be Converted to Java File But It Depends On You What You want To LearnðŸ˜Š. By Learning These You will Get That What Actually is Happening How Code is Working and Stuff Like ThatâœŒ
There are Two Types of Analysis And Both Plays a Major Part in Android Analysis
Static Analysis Means Where You Look into Code and Uncovers a Bug Now it\'s Most Time Consuming Thing But It is Necessary
So Passive Analysis Where You Look into Basic Functionality of Like Logs And Receiving Req. in Burp
Now In This Section We Will Talk About Common Issues
In This Section We Find And Report About MisUses of Different Components Like WebView And Intent of Mobile Operating System
In This Section If An App is Storing Information On Root Folder Like Password and Email and Other Information And If Mobile is Lost Then Attacker Can Access These Things
So As Per My Experience I Found a Bug on App Where Everything is Stored On Logs and If Attacker Gets Access to Phone For 10 Sec Then He Will Get All Information About UserðŸ˜Š
In This I Found Two Scenarios First One is Poor SSL or Certificate is Expired And Second One is Uses of HTTP Header on Sensitive Actions
For More About These Go On Owasp Link Will Be in Resource Section
What I Find Mostly or What\'s My Keymap to Find
The Reason Behind Choosing Jadx Because I was Using Dex2Jar And JdGui They were Good But Jadx Give me More Understandable UI, More Useful Search
As I Tried APKTOOL I Found That it is Also a Good Tool But One Thing I Didn\'t Liked About That it Converts in .SMALI But Yes There are Tools Convert SMALI to Java Class

I Used it Before Jadx Introduced to Me But It is a Good Tool First Decompile Apk via DEX2JAR and Then Open With Jd-GUi(Windows), One Thing I Didn\'t Liked About JD-GUI That It will Not Show You XML Files
This is An Example, This Can be Encrypted or Not
